1. <textformat blockindent='13'>Networks should always be available.</textformat>
2. <textformat blockindent='13'>Full memory queues mean packets must be dropped.</textformat>
3. <textformat blockindent='13'>Priority queues are implemented when demand for network bandwidth exceeds supply.</textformat>
4. <textformat blockindent='13'>Business and personal network equipment must be protected.</textformat>
5. <textformat blockindent='13'>Developing a plan for priority queuing is a strategy for quality delivery of information. </textformat>
6. <textformat blockindent='13'>Business and personal data must be protected.</textformat>
7. <textformat blockindent='13'>Different types of Internet Service Providers can affect the quality of network data delivery.</textformat>
8. <textformat blockindent='13'>Networks can grow or expand with minimal impact on performance.</textformat>
9. <textformat blockindent='13'>Priority for queuing packets is based on the type of data sent and how important it may be.</textformat>
10. <textformat blockindent='18'>Data can travel through more than one route for delivery from a remote source.</textformat>
11. <textformat blockindent='21'>Types of network equipment, how they are identified (IP address/MAC address), and how they are named can have an impact on the growth of a network.</textformat>
12. <textformat blockindent='21'>Many tools and procedures are being implemented to address the need to exchange confidential and business critical information.</textformat>
13. <textformat blockindent='21'>Traffic delay and data loss should be considered when setting up delivery through priority queuing.</textformat>
14. <textformat blockindent='21'>Compromising the integrity of crucial business and personal assets could have serious repercussions.</textformat>
15. <textformat blockindent='21'>Common network standards allow hardware and software vendors to focus on product improvements and services.</textformat>
16. <textformat blockindent='21'>Types of network connectivity can affect delivery of information.</textformat>
